creator: Ministère Santé et Services Sociaux du Québec
descriptionHtml:
VaxiCode is the official application from the gouvernement du Québec to allow citizens to securely record their proof of vaccination containing a QR code.
---
It allows citizens to register multiple proofs of vaccination containing a QR code, as well as verify the contents of each of the QR codes.

With VaxiCode, users can also know their protection status from COVID-19, through an interpretation of their proof of vaccination.

The proof of vaccination saved in VaxiCode is encrypted on the device and is not transmitted to anyone. Only a presentation of the QR code allows the user to communicate their proof of vaccination to a third party.

No usage analytics are collected by VaxiCode.

VaxiCode requires a weekly update, via the Internet, of the vaccine protection rules. The app asks for user consent before downloading new rules. The only communication with the Internet by VaxiCode takes place when checking the availability of these updates.

Access to the camera is required to read QR codes of proof of vaccination, or access to the phone's photo library to import the image of proof of vaccination.

appDetails.developerAddress:
Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux
Direction générale des technologies de l'information (DGTI)

930, chemin Sainte-Foy
Québec QC G1S 2L4
Canada
appDetails.developerName: Ministère Santé et Services Sociaux du Québec
appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- Improved vaccination proof verifier
- Improvements for devices with smaller screens
- Accessibility improvements

appDetails.developerName: Ministère Santé et Services Sociaux du Québec
appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
The vaccine protection rules have been updated.

Proof of vaccination can now be recorded regardless of phone configuration. Previously, on some phones, storage was limited to a few records only.

The “Add a Proof” dialog has been changed to be more accessible.

appDetails.developerName: Ministère Santé et Services Sociaux du Québec
appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
Added a new feature that allows users to present proof of vaccination for travel purposes (Canadian format).
This option only appears for QR codes in a compatible format. To get a compatible version of your QR code in VaxiCode, view the QR code details, then tap "Update".

Note: QR codes obtained before October 19, 2021 are not compatible for travel but are still accepted in Quebec.

930, chemin Sainte-Foy
Québec QC G1S 2L4
Canada

creator: Ministère Santé et Services Sociaux du Québec
descriptionHtml:
VaxiCode is the official application from the gouvernement du Québec to allow citizens to securely record their proof of vaccination containing a QR code.
---
It allows citizens to register multiple proofs of vaccination containing a QR code, as well as verify the contents of each of the QR codes.

With VaxiCode, users can also know their protection status from COVID-19, through an interpretation of their proof of vaccination.

The proof of vaccination saved in VaxiCode is encrypted on the device and is not transmitted to anyone. Only a presentation of the QR code allows the user to communicate their proof of vaccination to a third party.

No usage analytics are collected by VaxiCode.

VaxiCode requires a weekly update, via the Internet, of the vaccine protection rules. The app asks for user consent before downloading new rules. The only communication with the Internet by VaxiCode takes place when checking the availability of these updates.

Access to the camera is required to read QR codes of proof of vaccination, or access to the phone's photo library to import the image of proof of vaccination.
